svg.desc: This graphic provides a formal visualization of the global regularity proof for the 3D incompressible Navier-Stokes equations using the Operational Geometry (OpGeom) framework. Contrary to traditional analytical approaches that focus solely on a priori estimates, this framework identifies a geometric bottleneck inherent in the incompressibility constraint that prevents finite-time blowup. The graphic details the logical chain from Intrinsic Operational Gradient theory to the Beale-Kato-Majda (BKM) criterion, mapping the cost of angular refinement in a 3D fluid. Zelenka_D_D | Operational Geometry Framework | DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.18214940
svg.text: Operational Geometry Framework | Clay Millennium Problem

g.text: Key Insight: Incompressibility forces 2D threading → Angular entropy bounded → No blowup
